intro: Scilla lazulina, commonly known as blue scilla, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant produces narrow, grass-like leaves and blooms in early spring. Scilla lazulina typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
